channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Donald Trump calls Kamala Harris a 'liar,' 'nasty' and 'mean'
item.description: President Donald Trump's campaign is already seeking to make hay out of angry clashes between former Vice President Joe Biden and his VP selection Sen. Kamala Harris.

item.title: UK OFFICIALLY in recession after plunging by shocking 20.4%
item.description: Figures showed UK plc shrank by a shocking 20.4 per cent in the three months to June, the biggest fall in modern history, with record reductions in construction, services and production.

item.title: ASK TONY: Van crashed into my wall but insurer wants its money back
item.description: A van crashed in to my front garden wall, damaging it and my gate railings. I contacted my house insurer, Churchill, to ask it to claim on the driver's car insurance.

item.title: Thunderstorm warnings across UK as nation braces for flash flooding, but sun continues elsewhere
item.description: The flooding comes as the very hot temperatures gripping parts of Britain continued today with 97F (37C) expected in southern England, continuing the heatwave which began last Wednesday.

item.title: It's never too late to start a new career: How you can make the leap
item.description: The pandemic has turned the jobs market upside down. Previously stable industries are on the brink of mass layoffs, while some smaller sectors are now struggling to keep up with a surge in demand.

item.title: Fancy being your own boss? Your guide to striking out on your own
item.description: The Bank of England revised its unemployment forecast down from 10% to 7.5% but firms continue to haemorrhage jobs and the economy may not recover until next year. Is it time to be your own boss?

item.title: Boy, 6, loses foot after mother runs him over with lawnmower
item.description: Jonah Douglas was playing outside when mother Bethany, 41, crashed into him while driving the ride-on garden tool at their home in Missouri.

item.title: Customers forced to wait THREE HOURS to talk to their bank
item.description: Banking customers unable to visit a branch are being forced to wait hours on the phone, our probe has revealed. It is the latest blow for people struggling to get a basic banking service in the pandemic.

item.title: RAF airman, 25, who was 'determined to win' rugby match against the Army died of brain injury
item.description: Senior aircraftman Scott Stevenson, 25, who was based at RAF Marham, Norfolk, was hurt playing in an inter-services match lsat year.

item.title: Migrants crossing English Channel warn Britain they will attempt to DROWN if their boats are stopped
item.description: Families preparing to make the crossing to Britain from Calais claim the stretch of water will become 'a sea of bodies' if the British government intervenes and sends them back to France.

item.title: Child savers missing out on £3m a year as Junior Isa rates are axed
item.description: Families poured around £555m into cash Junior Isas last year. But the average rate is now down at 1.91 per cent from 2.46 per cent at the start of the year, according to data firm Moneyfacts.

item.title: Vladimir Putin's coronavirus vaccine 'was approved after tests on 38 people'
item.description: The much-trumpeted Russian drug was registered after just 42 days of research, Fontanka news agency says - and its effectiveness is said to be 'unknown'.

item.title: Ed Sheeran and wife Cherry Seaborn 'expecting their first child together in a matter of WEEKS'
item.description: The chart-topping singer, 29, and Cherry, 27, who first met at school, are said to be weeks away from becoming parents, after keeping her pregnancy quiet during the global COVID-19 lockdown.

item.title: Meghan Markle was 'furious' at 'absurd claims' against her from her own family
item.description: Prince Harry also couldn't believe how 'badly' his new partner's relatives had behaved after giving a series of interviews, the book claims.

item.title: Courtiers feared for future of the royals and even the Queen was concerned, new book claims
item.description: Royal courtiers feared the rift between Princes William and Harry could spell the end of the monarchy, a controversial new book claims.

item.title: The 26 most toe-curling Finding Freedom quotes: Meghan's packing skills and Harry 'tough to impress'
item.description: Controversial new Harry and Meghan biography Finding Freedom was finally released today but eyebrows have been raised by the fullsome praise heaped on the couple in the book

item.title: RICHARD KAY's devastating verdict on sensational new royals book Finding Freedom
item.description: RICHARD KAY: What possessed the Sussexes, however tacitly, to support the authors of this book is utterly baffling.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle secretly buy Santa Barbara home because 'it was not Harry's style'
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have been living in the home since early July, after staying in Tyler Perry's Beverly Hill's mansion for the last few months.

item.title: Prince Charles's 70th birthday photo was 'nightmare,' book says
item.description: A source said it was difficult to arrange as 'neither William nor Harry made much of an effort to make themselves available'. Charles and Harry's relationship was described as 'complicated'

item.title: Did Prince Harry and Meghan Markle 'collude' with book authors?
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The controversial biography written by Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand was released today and raised eyebrows for its intimate knowledge of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.

item.title: It will take more than half-price dinners to dig us out of this hole, writes Sir ROCCO FORTE
item.description: ROCCO FORTE: Does the Government really want to get the economy moving again? Because if so, it is going about it in a funny way.

item.title: Ending free TV licences for over-75s has created a 'bonanza' for fraudsters
item.description: Some of the UK's over-75s have already received scam letters, emails and texts ordering them to pay up within days of the free TV licence entitlement being scrapped on August 1.

item.title: Rail chiefs call for rises in road tax and aviation fuel levy to slash carbon emissions
item.description: Rail bosses are urging ministers to raise taxes on road and aviation fuel to cut carbon emissions and encourage more people to travel by train.

item.title: Stephen Lawrence's mother accuses Met Police of giving up on nailing her son's killers
item.description: In a statement 27 years after Stephen Lawrence was murdered in London, Met chief Dame Cressida Dick said the inquiry had run out of leads, saying it had entered an 'inactive phase'.

item.title: Backlash over Government plans to give pupils 'triple lock' on grades
item.description: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson last night ripped up the system just 36 hours before A-level results are released in the wake of the Scottish exams fiasco.

item.title: Surrey firefighters went SIX HOURS without drinking water
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Surrey Fire and Rescue was 'obliterated' and others were 'on their knees' as a blaze rampaged across Chobham Common since Friday.

item.title: Stockholm blow for hopes that herd immunity will combat the coronavirus
item.description: Only 15 per cent of Stockholm residents caught coronavirus despite Sweden not imposing a lockdown - as research suggests herd immunity is not an effective Covid-19 strategy.

item.title: Germany suffers worst daily spike in coronavirus cases since May with 1,226 new infections
item.description: German officials announced 1,226 new cases this morning, the highest figure since May 9 - bringing the total from 217,293 to 218,519 (daily cases are shown on a graph).

item.title: Coronavirus France: Tourists fearful as hospitalisations RISE
item.description: In a blow to the Portuguese economy that benefits greatly from tourism from the UK, the UK Government was warned that cases in Portugal had not fallen fast enough.

item.title: Finding Freedom authors appear to confirm Prince Harry and Meghan Markle DID speak to them
item.description: In the author's note for the Duke and Duchess of Sussexes' biography Finding Freedom, Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand write they 'have spoken with, when appropriate, the couple'

item.title: Woman, 35, pregnant with first child reveals her husband is trying to make her have an abortion
item.description: A British woman, 35, who was told by her husband to have an abortion took to Mumsnet for advice. She explained that her husband doesn't think she's mentally strong enough for a baby.

item.title: Woman, 35, pregnant with first child reveals her husband is trying to make her have an abortion
item.description: A British woman, 35, who was told by her husband to have an abortion took to Mumsnet for advice. She explained that her husband doesn't think she's mentally strong enough for a baby.

item.title: Woman, 34, had veins in her vagina removed without pain relief after sex left her in chronic pain
item.description: Victoria Jenkins, 34, from Islington, London, had veins in her vagina removed without pain relief after a medical condition left her in chronic pain everytime she had sex with her boyfriend.

item.title: Nightmare that stops with cladding millions selling their flats
item.description: James Gilham, his partner and one-year-old daughter have been unable to move to their dream home because they cannot get documents to show that the flat they were selling is not a fire risk.

item.title: Cloud bread becomes the latest lockdown food trend to takeover Instagram and TikTok
item.description: The latest trend to takeover Instagram and TikTok is cloud bread, with millions of people across the world whipping up the simple, very colourful, four-ingredient recipe.

item.title: Creative behind Missguided advert banned for being 'too sexual' says she was PRAISED by the CEO
item.description: Treasure, a senior creative and campaign manager for Missguided in Manchester, defended an advert for the brand that was deemed too sexual and said she was praised by the CEO Nitin Passi for the reaction.

item.title: Coronavirus US: New York City may take YEARS to recover
item.description: 'There's no reason to do business in New York,' said Michael Weinstein, the chief executive of Ark Restaurants, which owns Bryant Park Grill & Cafe in Manhattan and 19 other restaurants.

item.title: Jessica Mulroney returns to Instagram after race row
item.description: Jessica, 40, shared a video of her husband Ben, 44, bringing out a cake to their twin sons, Brian and John, while singing Happy Birthday.

item.title: This bestselling £6.99 sleep mask has received thousands of glowing Amazon reviews
item.description: This Gritin Sleep Mask has had nearly 8,000 reviews on Amazon. Priced at £6.99, it's the number one bestseller in sleep masks, with shoppers raving about its ability to block out all light.

item.title: Labour peer 'coaches teachers on how they can avoid return to school'
item.description: John Hendy QC, one of the country's preeminent labour law scholars, has briefed various teachers' unions on how their members can avoid the sack by using employee protection laws.

item.title: Early Britons ate every part of horse almost 500,000 years ago
item.description: An archeological dig at a site in Boxgrove, Sussex, which is home to Britain's oldest human remains, revealed the mare's remains.

item.title: Epstein's closest friends laugh and play-fight in newly-uncovered photos taken on 'pedophile island'
item.description: Never-before-seen images show Ghislaine Maxwell and Jean-Luc Brunel, Jeffrey Epstein's closest friends and alleged conspirators in his child sex ring, playing together on the pedophile's island.

item.title: Women are using self tanning foam to contour their cheekbones
item.description: The trend, which has been dubbed 'tantouring', involves drawing a semi-permanent shadow line under the cheekbone, highlighting the area longer than bronzer and contour-specific creams could.

item.title: Ben & Jerry's goes on Twitter attack over Home Secretary's call for Navy to police the Channel
item.description: The spat began when Ben & Jerry's UK Twitter account posted: 'We think the real crisis is our lack of humanity for people fleeing war, climate change and torture.'

item.title: Dinosaur bones found on the Isle of Wight belong to a new species of theropod
item.description: Palaeontologists from the University of Southampton have been studying four bones from the new dinosaur that was up to 13ft long and related to modern birds.

item.title: Biden is mocked for using a SCRIPT during call to Kamala Harris asking her to be his running mate
item.description: Joe Biden has been mocked by his adversaries for using a script during his call to tell Kamala Harris she was his running mate, with critics saying it was further evidence of his failing mental capacity.

item.title: SARAH VINE: Beware turning a staycation fantasy into reality
item.description: SARAH VINE: After months cooped up in the city, I had an absurd Famous Five fantasy of giving them a week of sun, surf and seafood.

item.title: Taylor Swift and LeBron James lead celebs in congratulating Kamala Harris on being Biden's VP pick
item.description: Joe Biden ended weeks of speculation about his vice-presidential choice on Tuesday with her celebrity fans quick to share their delight. LeBron James, Taylor Swift and John Legend lead the jubilation.

item.title: Policewoman, 28, claims she was 'brainwashed' into performing sex acts on married sergeant
item.description: Jemma Dicks and Adam Reed were said to have conducted a 'clumsy and awkward affair' which led to her performing oral sex on her superior on at least three occasions at Cardiff Central police station.

item.title: Professional stuntman asks girlfriend to marry him - whilst on fire
item.description: Footage shows how Riky Ash, 52, made a unique proposal to his sweetheart as he was covered in flames spreading up his back and legs.

item.title: How to make perfect peanut brittle in the MICROWAVE
item.description: An Australian home baker has shared how she made delicious peanut brittle using the microwave instead of the kitchen stovetop. The recipe is very simple and only takes 35 minutes to complete.

item.title: France intercepts just one in five migrants crossing the Channel
item.description: Immigration minister Chris Philp said France caught 'well over a thousand' migrants making the crossing this year - suggesting the proportion of those intercepted is roughly one fifth.

item.title: Kamala Harris: Joe Biden's running mate's career full of firsts
item.description: Kamala Harris, 55, is Joe Biden's VP pick for the Democratic nomination, it was announced on Tuesday.

item.title: Mother of boy, 8, seen being HANDCUFFED at his elementary school files civil rights suit
item.description: Bianca Digennaro, the mother of an eight-year-old boy with special needs arrested at his Key West school, has announced that she is to sue the schools district, teachers, city and officers.

item.title: Mother of boy, 8, seen being HANDCUFFED at his elementary school files civil rights suit
item.description: Bianca Digennaro, the mother of an eight-year-old boy with special needs arrested at his Key West school, has announced that she is to sue the schools district, teachers, city and officers.

item.title: US Election 2020: Kamala Harris is Joe Biden's running mate
item.description: Joe Biden named Kamala Harris as his running mate to help him defeat President Donald Trump this November, a historic choice that acknowledges the role black voters will play in the election.

item.title: Woman reveals how weights can change the entire look of your body in telling transformation pictures
item.description: A woman living in Australia with 'no fitness experience' has explained why she swears by weight lifting for transforming your body in a short space of time.

item.title: 'I will forever be the King of New York': Tekashi 6ix9ine draws a massive indoor crowd in NYC
item.description: Tekashi, whose real name is Daniel Hernandez shared a clip in which he was seated in a medical office while a physician tended to his arm, which was bandaged up.

item.title: Has Romeo Beckham, 17, got his first tattoo?
item.description: Romeo Beckham appears to have followed in his families' footsteps, as he debuted what seemed to be his first tattoo while on holiday in Greece on Tuesday.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV
item.description: This joke was ancient even in the heyday of the Victorian music hall: a man staggers into hospital, begging 'doctor, doctor, I've got this terrible pain in my head, bang in the middle of my forehead'.

item.title: Mystery as assailants torture, mutilate and kill horses in spate of gruesome attacks in France
item.description: A one-year-old horse was discovered in France with its right ear cut off, one of its eyes gouged out, its neck slashed and its genitals cut away, but police are struggling to find suspects or motive.

item.title: Russia's coronavirus 'vaccine' announced - but don't dismiss it just yet, writes BEN SPENCER
item.description: BEN SPENCER: Russia has a proud history of scientific achievements - it sent the first human into space and for decades led the world in the fields of engineering, mathematics and physics.

item.title: More Britons have been killed by flu and pneumonia than coronavirus for seven weeks
item.description: Research published by the Office for National Statistics found influenza caused more deaths in the UK than Covid-19 between June 19 and July 31.

item.title: Ethel the 6ft fugitive emu who spent six days evading police and RSPCA is 'back home'
item.description: The timid emu had reportedly been accidentally let out of her enclosure by builders at owner Kerry Dobson's home in Doncaster, South Yorks, before getting lost in woodland.

item.title: Do some vitamin drip treatments present some very real and serious risks?
item.description: Lynette, 38 (left) has spoken of the side effects she experienced after getting a 'wellness drip' and just six weeks ago, 63-year-old Rita Sauguniene collapsed and died after having one.

item.title: Coronavirus New Zealand: Panic-buying starts amid lockdown
item.description: Ms Ardern implemented stay-at-home orders throughout Auckland for 72 hours from midday on Wednesday after four new cases of COVID-19 were diagnosed.

item.title: 'Unemployment map' of Britain: Blackpool tops list of areas hit hardest by Covid jobs bloodbath
item.description: Blackpool topped the list of areas where working-aged residents claim state support, with 12.3% of the population on Universal Credit. Pictured: Percentages of UK population claiming.

item.title: Mum shares her top secret 'grandmother's recipe' for quick and easy beef rissoles
item.description: An Australian home cook has shared her grandmother's recipe for quick and easy beef rissoles - and they take less than half an hour to make in an air fryer.

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: Shining a light on Stephen Lawrence's murder has helped make Britain a fairer place
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: What should we feel now that the investigation into the murder of black teenager Stephen Lawrence 27 years ago has for all practical purposes been wound up?

item.title: Coronavirus: Charity advises that masks are worn during sex
item.description: The Terrence Higgins Trust (THT), a leading HIV and sexual health charity in the UK, has published guidance for sexual partners amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Boris Johnson's camping holiday sounds a right Carrie on
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Boris Johnson's summer holiday plans have caused hilarity among his friends and former lovers.

item.title: Boy, 16, is found guilty of stabbing to death promising footballer, 15
item.description: The 16-year-old stabbed promising footballer Baptista Adjei twice in the chest with a hunting knife with a ten-inch blade in front of a group of terrified schoolchildren. A second boy was found not guilty.

item.title: Ryanair, TUI and Virgin Atlantic are STILL denying holidaymakers refunds says Which?
item.description: After an investigation by the UK's CAA, airlines promised to speed up their performance and said they would issue refunds within various agreed timeframes.

item.title: Boyfriend tries to propose on a boat - only for his best man to throw the ring overboard
item.description: A man named Miles wanted to pop the question to his girlfriend Angie Zalesov on the bow of a boat in Sarasota, Florida.

item.title: Black bear casually joins a Maryland family forest picnic
item.description: A group staying in a cabin in remote woodland in Maryland were joined by a Black Bear who took a seat at their picnic table as they enjoyed lunch last Thursday.

item.title: Woman swims into path of curious eight-foot shark in the Bahamas
item.description: Iso Machado, who lives in Miami, was celebrating her birthday on a friend's boat last Friday in the Bahamas when she found herself just inches away from a massive shark.

item.title: Read JENNY JOHNSTON's surreal encounter with Brian Blessed
item.description: This week, Blessed, 83, claimed the Queen had told him: 'We watch Flash Gordon all the time, me and the grandchildren.' He insisted that she even begged him to repeat his catchphrase from the film.

item.title: Twitter users can ban others from replying with new feature
item.description: Twitter rolled out a moderation feature that lets users choose who can and cannot reply to their tweets. Users can select between everyone, only people they follow or mention in the post.

item.title: Dr Dre and Katy Perry have solar panels on eco-friendly homes
item.description: DailyMail.com can reveal Hollywood's most glamorous eco-friendly homes seen in incredible aerial shots.

item.title: UK records highest number of new coronavirus cases in seven weeks
item.description: The UK today recorded its highest number of new coronavirus cases in seven weeks with 1,148 infections and a further 102 deaths across the country.

item.title: Sperm donor loses High Court battle to see daughter, 6
item.description: Mrs Justice Theis concluded contact between the child and her biological father would not meet the 'welfare needs' of the girl at the High Court in London.

item.title: Study says CBD improves brain's blood flow and helps the mind
item.description: MRI scans showed that CBD capsules increased blood flow to the hippocampus, responsible for memories and the orbitofrontal cortex, responsible for decision-making,

item.title: How serial killer Jose Martinez got away with 36 murders
item.description: According to a new book, The Devil's Harvest by journalist Jessica Garrison, Martinez was a contract killer who also murdered for other reasons in California and other states.

item.title: UK woman, 24, dies of 'sudden adult death syndrome' on holiday
item.description: Jessica Welsby, 24, from St Helens, had travelled to Melbourne with her boyfriend as part of an international exchange programme with the company she worked for.

item.title: Google to alert Android users of earthquakes before they strike
item.description: Google is transforming Android smartphones into early earthquake detectors. The firm now alerts users in California about an event with enough time for them to take cover.

item.title: Wild deer eat from plastic bags in London's Royal Parks
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Two deer have been filmed rummaging through rubbish and eating plastic after bins were left overflowing by visitors at Bushy Park in south west London.

item.title: Man accused of murder of daughter, 13, threw her as a baby
item.description: Dean Smith, 45, from Watford, Hertfordshire, threw his daughter Maisie Newell into her cot when she was just four-weeks-old in August 2000 and left her with a fractured skull and brain injuries.

item.title: 'Smart' bricks costing as little as 50p each can store electricity
item.description: Researchers from Washington University found a way to convert simple 'red bricks' into energy storage units that could be charged to power lighting in a home.

item.title: Prince Harry was 'closest of friends' with Princess Eugenie
item.description: Princess Eugenie, 30, was one of the first royals to hear about Meghan from Harry, due to their close bond, bombshell biography Finding Freedom by Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand, out today, reveals.

item.title: HMS Victory 'floats' again as Lord Nelson's ship is viewable from below for first time in 100 years
item.description: The support structure, which consists of 134 metal props, are part of renovation works which will also replicate the 3,600-tonne vessel being at sea, at Portsmouth Historic Dockyard.

item.title: Drunk tourist strips naked then climbs onto a Buddhist shrine where she chants, rants and swears
item.description: Farah Haque, 28, was caught on camera as she clambered up to the religious site in Chiang Mai, northern Thailand, yesterday evening.

item.title: Half tonne 'demon' crocodile is captured and BEHEADED in Indonesia
item.description: A 14-ft long 'demon' crocodile was trapped and beheaded by superstitious villagers in Indonesia last week. The 50-year-old beast weighed 500kg and had to be carried by bulldozer to be buried.
